H0.text: The nervous system is the organ system that can be divided by function into somatic and autonomic control.

H1.text: The cardiovascular system is an organ system that can be divided by function into somatic or autonomic control of the body.

H2.text: The circulatory system is the organ system that can be divided by function into somatic and autonomic control.

H3.text: Central system is the organ system that can be divided by function into somatic or autonomic control.

A4.text: The PNS is divided into two separate subsystems, the somatic and autonomic nervous systems.

A5.text: The visceral part, also known as the autonomic nervous system, contains neurons that innervate the internal organs, blood vessels, and glands.
